sentence.Network_en: These policies are inimical to the interests of society.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些政策有损于社会的利益。

sentence.Network_en: The South had entangled itself in a severely conservative countermythology inimical to creative effort.
sentence.Network_cn: 南方纠缠于极端保守的反神话倾向,对创作活动很不利.

sentence.Network_en: A Quaker child in an inimical New England settlement is stoned by the other children.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个教友会的孩子,在敌视他的新英格兰村落里,被别的孩子用石头打了.

抵触的英文|抵触是什么意思|Show秀网_专业翻译 ... 相抵触 ： conflict 抵触的 ： inimical 抵触的 ： conflicting opposing.
inhumane adj 不近人情的inimical adj．为敌的，不友善的inimitable adj．无法仿效的，不可比拟的.
" Loneliness , " wrote Carl Jung , " is not necessarily inimical to companionship , for no one is more sensitive to companionship than the lonely man .卡尔·杨写道：“孤独不必对友谊怀有敌意，因为没有人比孤独的人对友谊更敏感了。”

listen to this apparent to have no inimical words , spend not intentional wrinkly tight eyebrows to now unfold .听着这句明显没有敌意的话，花无心皱紧的眉头顿时舒展。
Looking for an extra advantage against that inimical magic user ?, 对付那些敌对的法术使用者时想要额外的优势么?
people must stop when cheer , won't have inimical sentiment , notice the thing of detail easily , advertising effect is better .人们在加油的时候必须停下来，不会有抵触的情绪，容易注意到细节的东西，广告的效果比较好。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from late Latin inimicalis, from Latin inimicus (see enemy)

entry.def: Conditions that are inimical to something make it difficult for that thing to exist or do well.

example.ex: ...a false morality that is inimical to human happiness.
example.tran: 对人类幸福不利的虚假道德
不利于西方利益的目标
